Package it.polimi.ingsw.view.GUI

Class ClientGUI

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.view.GUI.ClientGUI
All Implemented Interfaces:
ViewObserver, View
public class ClientGUI extends Object implements View
This class implements visual functions needed by the GUI version of the game to run. It utilize JavaFX and fxml files.

    • drawStartingPhaseDone

      public void drawStartingPhaseDone()
      Calls a scene load after the starting phase is finished, loads the main screen of the game and puts everything disable until every player has finished its starting phase. Every operation is managed by the scene proxy, which gets the calls and delivers them to the right controller.
      Specified by:
      drawStartingPhaseDone in interface View

    • drawLeadersChoiceLayout

      public void drawLeadersChoiceLayout()
      Calls a scene and cards load for the initial leaders choice. Every operation is managed by the scene proxy, which gets the calls and delivers them to the right controller.
      Specified by:
      drawLeadersChoiceLayout in interface View

    • drawResourcesChoiceLayout

      public void drawResourcesChoiceLayout​(int yourPosition)
      Calls a scene and resources images load for the initial resource/s choice/s. Every operation is managed by the scene proxy, which gets the calls and delivers them to the right controller.
      Specified by:
      drawResourcesChoiceLayout in interface View
      Parameters:
      yourPosition - to print a more precise layout on how many resources you can pick

    • drawYourTurnLayout

      Parameters:

    • drawGoodbyeLayout

      public void drawGoodbyeLayout​(String msg)
      Calls a scene load, for server's disconnections handling. It also calls a goodbye message print. The operations are managed by the scene proxy, which gets the calls and delivers them to the right controller.
      Specified by:
      drawGoodbyeLayout in interface View
      Parameters:
      msg - the goodbye message

    • printTokenDraw

      public void printTokenDraw​(String tokenName, int remainingTokens)
      Calls a new token's visualization on the scene proxy. The scene proxy delivers the call to the right controller.
      Specified by:
      printTokenDraw in interface View
      Parameters:
      tokenName - the name of the token
      remainingTokens - the number of tokens left

    • printLastRound

      public void printLastRound()
      Calls a last round flag's visualization method on the scene proxy. The scene proxy delivers the call to the right controller.
      Specified by:
      printLastRound in interface View

    • setLastRound

      public void setLastRound​(boolean lastRound)
      Calls a setter method on the scene proxy, which will deliver the call to the right controller (TurnScene).
      Specified by:
      setLastRound in interface View
      Parameters:
      lastRound - the last round flag

    • printMatchResults

      public void printMatchResults​(String message, Map<String,​Integer> ranking)
      Calls a final match ranking visualization's method on the scene proxy. The scene proxy delivers the call to the right controller (RematchPhaseScene).
      Specified by:
      printMatchResults in interface View
      Parameters:
      message - an end match message
      ranking - the non-sorted ranking map

    • printRetry

      public void printRetry​(String errMessage, StateName currentState, LightMatch match)
      Calls a scene proxy's error print method and, eventually graphic reset methods, depending on the current state of the player. The scene proxy delivers the precise call to the right scene controller.
      Specified by:
      printRetry in interface View
      Parameters:
      errMessage - the error message
      currentState - the state after the unacceptable move (usually the same as before)
      match - the match

    • updateMatch

      public void updateMatch​(LightMatch match)
      Calls a card map setter method on the scene proxy, useful for almost every scene controller to correctly print cards on the scenes and know their abilities (some leaders need to activate an extra shelf, others need to be produced, etc.).
      Specified by:
      updateMatch in interface ViewObserver
      Parameters:
      match - the match

    • updateMarket

      public void updateMarket​(LightMatch match)
      Calls an update method for the market. This operation is handled by the scene proxy, which gets the call and delivers it to the right controller (TurnScene).
      Specified by:
      updateMarket in interface ViewObserver
      Parameters:
      match - the match

    • updateDisconnections

      public void updateDisconnections​(String nickname, boolean connected)
      Calls an update method for when a player's connection state changes (goes from online to offline or from offline to online). This operation is handled by the scene proxy, which gets the call and delivers it to the right controller (TurnScene).
      Specified by:
      updateDisconnections in interface ViewObserver
      Parameters:
      nickname - the nickname
      connected - the connection value
